title: False positive report for unaligned reference in a packed struct

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
It looks like the "reference to packed field is unaligned" is reported even when a reference points to an aligned field.


Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=65b76e22bb1337278a3a64d7008a2d7e

```rust
#[repr(C, packed)]
struct FooBazUnaligned {
    bar: u8,
    baz: usize
}

#[repr(C, packed)]
struct FooBazAligned {
    bar: u64,
    baz: usize,
}

#[repr(C, packed)]
struct FooBazStillAligned {
    bar: u128,
    baz: usize,
}

fn main() {
    let foo = FooBazUnaligned { bar: 1, baz: 2 };
    let _ = &foo.baz;

    let foo = FooBazAligned { bar: 1, baz: 2 };
    let _ = &foo.baz;

    let foo = FooBazStillAligned { bar: 1, baz: 2 };
    let _ = &foo.baz;
}

```

```
warning: reference to packed field is unaligned
  --> src/main.rs:21:13
   |
21 |     let _ = &foo.baz;
   |             ^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(unaligned_references)]` on by default
   = warning: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
   = note: for more information, see issue #82523 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82523>
   = note: fields of packed structs are not properly aligned, and creating a misaligned reference is undefined behavior (even if that reference is never dereferenced)

warning: reference to packed field is unaligned
  --> src/main.rs:24:13
   |
24 |     let _ = &foo.baz;
   |             ^^^^^^^^
   |
   = warning: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
   = note: for more information, see issue #82523 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82523>
   = note: fields of packed structs are not properly aligned, and creating a misaligned reference is undefined behavior (even if that reference is never dereferenced)

warning: reference to packed field is unaligned
  --> src/main.rs:27:13
   |
27 |     let _ = &foo.baz;
   |             ^^^^^^^^
   |
   = warning: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
   = note: for more information, see issue #82523 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82523>
   = note: fields of packed structs are not properly aligned, and creating a misaligned reference is undefined behavior (even if that reference is never dereferenced)

warning: 3 warnings emitted

    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.61s
     Running `target/debug/playground`
```

However, while the baz field in the first structure is indeed unaligned, the ones in the second and third structures aren't and therefore the warning seems like a false positive?
